data.title: Percentages!
data.solution:
from collections import defaultdict


n = int(input())
lines = [input() for _ in range(n)]

counting_dict = defaultdict(int)

for line in lines:
    counting_dict[line.strip()] += 1

total = sum(counting_dict.values())

for k, val in sorted(counting_dict.items(),
                        key=lambda k: k[1],
                        reverse=True):
    print(f"{val/total * 100:.1f}% {k}")
data.statement:
You must output each unique line of input with their percentage out of the total lines.

Percentage and line shall be separated by a single space character.

Round the percentage to 1 decimal point.
Sort descending by percentage (i.e. highest first).

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] for the number of lines to read
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> ASCII text
data.outputDescription:
<<[[x]] lines:>>  [[percentage]] [[line]]

Where [[x]] = number of unique lines.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must output each unique line of input with their percentage out of the total lines.

Percentage and line shall be separated by a single space character.

Round the percentage to 1 decimal point.
Sort descending by percentage (i.e. highest first).
Input
Line 1: An integer n for the number of lines to read
Next n lines: ASCII text
Output
x lines: percentage line

Where x = number of unique lines.
Constraints
1 < n < 100
line = ASCII text, length < 100

It is guaranteed that ordering by percentage yields unambiguous results.
Example
Input
6
Apple
Banana
Apple
Pear
Banana
Apple
Output
50.0% Apple
33.3% Banana
16.7% Pear
